We’re here to help with any enquiries or assistance you may need. Whether you’re looking to book a round on our 9 Hole Par 3 course, reserve a bay at our 13 bay floodlit driving range, schedule a golf lesson, or require club hire or repair services, our team is ready to assist. Contact Us | Progressive Golf Academy in London & Kent Follow us on Instagram Find us on Facebook 0800 334 5435 coaching@progressiongolfacademy.co. uk Contact Book Now Home Coaching Coaching Golf Lessons Indoor Golf Custom Fitting Club Repairs Prices & Packages Contact Us CONTACT US Get in Touch with Progression Golf Academy Whether you have questions about our coaching programmes, want to book a lesson, or need more information about our facilities, we’re here to help. Make an enquiry IMPROVE YOUR GOLF Book a Lesson To book a golf lesson, visit our Prices & Packages page or contact us directly. Whether you’re interested in indoor coaching, on-course training, or specialist lessons, we have a range of options to suit your needs. Book your session today and start improving your game. Book a lesson GET IN TOUCH Contact Details Reach out to us using the details below, and a member of our team will be happy to assist you. Phone For bookings and general enquiries, call us at: 0800 334 5435 Email Send us an email with your query, and we’ll get back to you as soon as possible: coaching@progressiongolfacademy.co.uk WhatsApp For bookings and general enquiries on WhatsApp, call us at: 07359 312219 Location We have training facilities in Sevenoaks, Kent and London. Contact us to book an appointment and arrange a session. Contact us to book an appointment and arrange a session. Make an enquiry MAKE A BOOKING Enquiry Form Fill out the form below, and we’ll get back to you as soon as possible. Instruction - Sweetbriar Golf Club - Legacy 18 Skip to main content Skip to primary sidebar Skip to footer Sweetbriar Golf Club - Legacy 18 Home Tee Times Legacy Course Tee Times Employee Tee Times Sweetbriar 9 Golf Book a Tee Time Driving Range Scorecards Golf Etiquette, Rules + Policies Golf Shop Club Fittings Courses Video Flyover Legacy 18 Sweetbriar 9 Legacy Hole by Hole Flyover Advertising Partnerships Instruction Instruction Kevin Moore Nikki St. Vincent Faith Egli Ciera Miller Golf Clinics Private Golf Lessons Restaurant Golf Outings Group Outings Request Event Information Contact Us Employment Application Buy Online Instruction Meet our Instructors Please call the golf shop at 440-933-9001 or email kevin@sweetbriargolfclub.com for Instruction staff availability and we will have a member of our staff contact you shortly. Kevin Moore, PGA | Director of Golf Course Operations/Head Golf Professional kevin@sweetbriargolfclub.com Kevin has been working at Sweetbriar since 2001. Kevin Started out working outside washing golf carts in Junior High School, worked inside in the proshop and then worked 5 seasons as the Assistant Golf Professional prior to taking the Head Golf Professional/Director of Golf Operations position he is in today. Golf has always been a passion of mine. At the age of 3, my father introduced and taught me the game of golf. I started playing competitively at the age of 10. At Avon Lake High School I was a 4 year varsity letterman and a three-time 1st team All-Conference member as well as Conference Player of the year in 2005. I took my love of golf with me to college where I earned a Bachelor of Science Degree in Sports Management at Cleveland State University in 2009. While attending CSU, I began working towards becoming a PGA Professional and in February 2012 I became a Class A PGA Professional. I reside in Avon Lake with my wife, Kristen, our son Brenden who was born on July 14th, 2016 and our Daughter Leah who was born January 24th 2019 Teaching Experience Previous to taking the Head Golf Professional/Director of Golf Course Operations position, I was the Assistant Golf Professional here at Sweetbriar for 4 years. Over this time, I have taught between 150-200 lessons annually and built up a large clientele base. I have extensive experience with teaching new, as well as experienced golfers, varying from men to juniors and women. My strengths as a teacher are my patience, my ability to communicate, and effectively relate to a wide range of individuals and experience levels. Teaching Philosophy “My goal in teaching is to give each one of my students the knowledge and skills necessary to make him or her the best golfer they can be, while improving the student’s fundamental understanding of the golf swing.” It is of the utmost importance to me that I tailor my teaching methodology to each student’s individual skill set and learning style. I also want to provide each student with a fun learning environment that helps him or her feel comfortable while exciting them when they come to the golf course. The most important thing to remember about this game is that it should always be about having fun. Nikki St. Vincent, LPGA | Teaching Professional nikki@sweetbriargolfclub.com Ever since I can remember, golf has always been in my life. I grew up working and playing golf at Twin Creeks Golf Course, which is owned and ran by my family in Illinois. I was taught by my dad and grandfather, both avid and accomplished golfers. At the age of eight, I played in my very first tournament, and went on to play competitive golf in high school and college. I played on scholarship at John A. Logan College and The University of Missouri at Kansas City, where I graduated with a Business Degree in 2004. I then moved to Arizona and had the privilege of working for The First Tee of Phoenix from 2007-2012. I was a Recognized Coach of The First Tee, where I taught Life Skills and Core Values to juniors locally and nationally. My love for the game came full circle when I met my husband. Our first date was 18 holes and we played every week after that. This ignited my desire to learn more, teach more and begin the process of becoming a member of the LPGA Teaching & Club Professionals. Soon thereafter, my husband and I moved back to the Midwest to be closer to our family. I’ve been an LPGA member since 2011 and have been teaching at Sweetbriar since 2013. I currently reside in Bay Village with my husband, Bobby, and my two sons, Wallace and August. My experience teaching has been extremely rewarding and I absolutely love what I do. I can think of nothing better than to help others learn and love the game as I have. My Teaching Philosophy: “Every student and every lesson is different from the last. Each student has their own goals, abilities, strengths and reasons for playing the game of golf. It’s my goal to discover the individuality of my student and create an effective, efficient and fun way for them to learn and be successful.” Faith Egli LPGA | Teaching Professional faith@sweetbriargolfclub.com Book a Lesson I have been playing golf for as long as I can remember, playing with my family and friends in Northern Michigan. I was fortunate to receive a scholarship to attend Michigan State University where I was honored with twice being named to the First Team All Big Ten team. From there, I went to play golf professionally, playing in the 1989 US Open and 12 LPGA tour events as well as 2 years on the mini tour. I joined the PGA of America and the LPGA Teaching division. My career has taken me where I have wore many hats from Head Golf Professional, General Manager, College Coach, and Golf Instructor. I was honored to earn a lifetime achievement award from the PGA and also being named a Top 50 LPGA Instructor and twice Professional of the Year. Teaching golf is my passion and what I choose to do as I have retired from the business side of the game. Four years teaching at Golftec helped me learn the modern ways of teaching which I have to admit have changed a lot as technology has changed. In my spare time I spend time with my family and 2 dogs, spend time relaxing at my cabin, hiking, boating, riding motorcycles, I’m a stock market junkie, and of course I love golfing. I look forward to helping you improve your golf game and reach your goals. Golfing Philosophy: Juniors: Have fun, start with solid fundamentals, play by the rules, keep improving Adults: Listen to determine what issues bother the student. Determine the root cause of what is happening, communicate the issue and explain why it is happening, show how to fix it, give drills and homework so they can progress. Ciera Rhodes | PGA | Assistant Professional ciera@sweetbriargolfclub.com I grew up in Bay Village, Ohio and attended their school system throughout my childhood. I played 4 years for the Bay Girls Varsity Team and decided I wanted to pursue golf further after High School. I attended Eastern Kentucky University and Majored in Marketing with a Concentration of PGA Professional Golf Management and graduated in 2017. I have been a full Class A PGA Member since May 2021. Since then, I have moved back to Ohio and live in the suburb of Lyndhurst with my husband and our dogs, cat and chickens. I have worked all around the Greater Cleveland Area at places such as Avon Oaks Country Club, Columbia Hills Country Club, Shaker Heights Country Club and Catawba Island Golf Club. All of which helped grow my knowledge teaching and how the golf world works! Teaching Philosophy: I have truly found my calling in life with growing the game golf to everyone who wants to learn. I have had the privilege of teaching and creating many lessons and clinics to Women, Men and Juniors over the past years at varying skill levels. I really focus on how my student’s bodies feel from the beginning to end of their swing as this can play into their limitations. I create each lesson plan according to each student’s goals and divide them into steps to get them there. My favorite part about teaching is whether or not the student is a beginner or advanced player, when they finally feel the connection of proper body rotation to impact their confidence for the whole game improves. John Grimm, PGA | Teaching Professional jgrimm@sweetbriargolfclub.com My entire adult life has been in the golf business. I stated as a PGA Apprentice at Chagrin Valley cc in 1974 and was elected to PGA Membership in 1978 and am now a Life Member of the PGA. In my 45 years of teaching golf I have worked successfully with men,women, seniors, and junior golfers from beginners to accomplished low handicap players. I have also taught many clinics at the clubs where I have worked and adult education and college classes at the University of Akron and Lorain County Community College. My teaching and coaching also includes high school golf. The schools where I have coached are Westlake, Strongsville, Medina, Copley, and ST. Vincent St Mary in Akron, coaching boys and girls varsity and junior varsity teams. Teaching Philosophy: My approach to teaching is straightforward teaching the fundamentals of the swing in the classical tradition and the short game. Drills and training aids are not part of my method as the time spent on drills and with aids is better spent practicing the actual swing the student is working on. Finally, let me say that I am pleased to be joining the staff at Sweetbriar and am looking forward to meeting and working my new students. Visit the Sweetbriar Driving Range & Practice Green Time spent at the driving range is a major part in developing your game. Our driving range offers several tees where lessons take place and we also have a large practice green to sharpen your putting skills before or after play. Primary Sidebar Footer About Us Prepare yourself for an unparalleled golfing experience. Our course is a pleasure for golfers of any skill level to play. Test your accuracy with our fairways, water hazards and sand traps; we have everything you need to challenge you and improve your game. Follow Us Facebook Instagram Phone (440) 933-9001 Address 750 Jaycox Rd. Avon Lake, OH 44012 Email kevin@sweetbriargolfclub.com Sweetbriar Golf Club – Legacy 18 | 750 Jaycox Rd. Avon Lake, OH 44012 | 440-933-9001 Copyright © 2025 Sweetbriar Golf Club – Legacy 18 All Rights Reserved. Powered by

Directions/Stay & Play | Kevin Perkins Home Airports and Accommodations Partners and Affiliates Teaching & Training Aids Photos Kevin Perkins Golf Management Kevin's Bio Programs/Rates School Packages Private Lessons Corporate Events Weekly Clinics Junior After School Program Junior Christmas Holiday Golf Camp Junior Spring Break Golf Camp Junior Summer Golf Camp Gift Certificates/FaceTime Lessons Academy Location TrackMan Launch Monitor Club/Ball Fitting Kevin's Book/Column Directions/Stay & Play Contact Us How to Find  Kevin Perkins Golf Academy at Sailfish Sands Golf Course Kevin Perkins Golf Academy at the Sailfish Sands Golf Course 2000 SE St. Lucie Blvd. Stuart, FL 34996 Email: dkperkins4@cs.com Phone: 561 301-3783 Kevin Perkins Golf Academy is located at the Sailfish Sands Golf Course . Sailfish Sands, is located in eastern Stuart on SE St. Lucie Blvd., 1/8 of a mile west of the St. Lucie River, 1 mile east of US Federal Highway and seven miles east of  interstate I-95. The KPGA is a thirty minute minute drive south and east from the PGA Village in Port St. Lucie and a five minute  drive from downtown Stuart, Florida. From US Federal Highway in Stuart, take Indian St. east 1.1 miles and then turn left on St. Lucie Blvd. Sailfish Sands is 1/4 of a mile on the left. Traveling south on I-95, take the Stuart exit (exit 101). Go left (east) on Kanner Hwy. Proceed 2.5 miles and turn right on Indian Street. Proceed 2.5 miles to St. Lucie Blvd and turn left. Sailfish Sands is 1/4 of a mile on the left. Traveling north on I-95, take the Stuart exit (exit 101). Go right (east) on Kanner Hwy. Proceed 2.5 miles and turn right on Indian Street. Proceed 2.5 miles to St. Lucie Blvd and turn left. Sailfish Sands is 1/4 of a mile on the left. Stay & Play Packages-Florida Just in case you have been considering getting out of the cold and taking a trip to Florida to work on your game and maybe taking a Private, Group or Playing Lesson, CLICK HERE or taking a Half, One, Two or Three Day Golf School, CLICK HERE , I want to give you possibly that little nudge to make it a reality! As most of you know we are located on the southeast coast of South Florida approximately 30 miles north of West Palm Beach. To help you with your accommodations, KPGA has also secured great Corporate Rates with a two local hotels on the Treasure Coast. The first hotel is the Hutchinson Shores Resort & Spa , located on the beach on beautiful Hutchinson Island, and is located approximately 6 miles from the KPGA. The second is the Hutchinson Island Resort by Marriott and is located 4 miles from the KPGA. © 2025 Kevin Perkins | [ ADMIN LOGIN ]

Golf Packages About Blog Insights Careers Contact Home > About Us About Us Premier Golf – Delivering custom golf vacations since 1988 Headquartered in Alpharetta, Georgia, Premier Golf provides a tailored service to golfers looking to combine their passion for the game with their love of travel. We are experienced in providing tailored international and domestic golf vacation packages to various iconic locations around the world. Our experts share the same enthusiasm for golf as you, and we are committed to providing the best itineraries to suit your needs, saving you time and hassle when it comes to choosing your next golf vacation. Meet our team > Get in touch > Trusted team of golf enthusiasts Offering international golf vacations Years of experience planning tailored trips and packages Providing specialist advice to create your dream trip Offices and representatives located around the world Working in partnership with the PGA Premier Golf has worked in partnership with the PGA for more than ten years, serving as the PGA Magazine Ambassador Program’s official travel company. This is a program that provides exposure to some of the world’s greatest golfing destinations. Upon visiting, staying and playing, they will return to their home clubs with the experience and knowledge to create a return trip with their members. As the dedicated travel provider, we have served hundreds of PGA professionals and their members over the years. “We want you to know how much we enjoyed our Ryder Cup tour. We would highly recommend you to our friends.” A.P, California “The trip was absolutely fabulous! The personal service you provided gave it a special touch. You are at the top of our list when we consider any future trips” D.V, Arizona “I just wanted to say a huge thank you for helping us have such a wonderful trip. It really went smoothly and my members were happy which is my ultimate goal. Really, I am so in awe of the great care you take of your clients.” A.J. Brewster, MA Meet our team Our team is committed to providing excellent customer service and helpful information. Our specialists are experts in global golf destinations and can help you with any queries you may have, or information you require. We are friendly yet professional, giving you confidence that you will receive the best expertise, from booking to boarding and during your trip. We have dedicated teams at various destinations to assist you upon your arrival and to ensure you have a seamless golfing experience. Ann Mabry Managing Director Managing Director of Premier Golf, with over 30 years of experience in the Golf Travel industry. Ann’s wealth of knowledge in luxury travel is incorporated into each unique Premier Golf itinerary, ensuring our clients enjoy and experience the best each destination has to offer. Born in Scotland and raised in Ireland, many people love to call us just to hear her talk. Ann lives in Suwanee, Georgia with her husband David and son Douglas. Suzie Cusentino Director of Operations After several years in accounting and finance positions, Suzie joined Premier Golf in 2010 as our Accounting Specialist and now serves as our Director of Operations. A key factor in the seamless operations of Premier Golf, Suzie also oversees our accounting, sales reporting, technology and golf reservations system. Suzie lives in Atlanta, Georgia. Bill Hogan Business Development Manager Bill Hogan is based in Austin, TX and has over 30 years of experience in the luxury golf travel industry. He has played golf in 57 different countries to date, is a long-time panelist for GOLF Magazine World & USA Top 100 courses, and on the ranking panel for Platinum Clubs of the World. Tim Stolz Sales Manager Having worked in the golf industry and management for over 20 years, Tim joined Premier Golf in May 2023 to provide leadership and experience to the sales team. Living in Marietta, GA with his wife Sasha and 3 dogs, Tim is the father of two daughters who have adopted his passion for sports and travel. An avid golfer with a 4 handicap, he cites his round at the Old Course as the greatest golf experience of his life. A native of Ohio, Tim is a passionate fan of the Buckeyes, Reds and Bengals. Mike Eaton Marketing Director Having worked in agency-side marketing for over a decade, Mike joined Premier Golf in 2022 as Marketing Manager. With a passion for sports and travel and a background in premium branding and marketing, Mike is combining his expertize and experience across the marketing spectrum and passions, to develop Premier Golf’s marketing activity moving forward. Originally from the UK, Mike is now based in Michigan and is regularly at HQ in Alpharetta. Kara Guthrie Senior Golf Travel Specialist Kara joined Premier Golf in 2021 as a Domestic Golf Travel Specialist, providing expertise to our clients who wish to travel across the US. Now a Senior Golf Travel Specialist, Kara provides her expert knowledge to create the ideal bespoke trips to Premier Golf clients for Ireland, Spain, and Portugal. With a passion to travel, having traveled all across Europe, and the US, Kara loves to help others create travel memories of their own and live out their dreams. Kara is also a keen golfer, having played from a young age with friends and family. Connor Vogel Golf Travel Specialist Connor has an extensive travel background including the US, Mexico & Europe, and has been fortunate enough to attended each of the 4 major championships. He brings this wealth of knowledge and expertise to his role, ensuring Premier Golf clients enjoy the best possible golf travel experience. With a background in supply chain & logistics, Connor’s thorough planning and attention to detail lends itself to creating seamless golf experiences. Having worked in the golf industry for a number of years, including as an Assistant Pro and Caddie, Connor is able to bring a deep understanding of the game to his role. In addition to Golf, Connor is a passionate fan of UGA Football and the English Premier League (Come on Arsenal!). He lives in Atlanta, GA with his wife Anna. Carlee Talty Marketing Executive Carlee is a recent graduate from the University of South Carolina, where she found her passion for working in sports. She has versatile experience in the sports world, from working for a professional sports agency all the way to being on the sideline at Carolina football games. These opportunities help Carlee support Premier Golf’s brand as a whole. In her free time, Carlee enjoys playing pickleball and has picked up golfing. Stacey Mabry Administrative Assistant With over 16 years in customer service, Stacey is a pivotal part of the Premier Golf client experience. Heavily involved in communications from booking, until they return, she ensures a seamless process for all. Based in Atlanta, Georgia, she is one of many Bulldogs fans on the Premier Golf team, she is also an avid tennis player. At home, Stacey enjoys life with her two boys, husband, dog and cat. Tim Willerton Senior Golf Travel Specialist Tim has been a golf tour operator and caddied on the PGA and LPGA Tours. A devoted and passionate golfer, he’s well traveled with special expertise on Scotland and Ireland. Topping his bucket list is playing golf in South Africa. Euan Findlay Head of DMC Operations Euan has been with Premier Golf since 1999, managing all Scotland activities. Born and raised in Glasgow, Euan studied at University in Edinburgh before continuing his studies on a golf scholarship in Kansas. A Course Rater for Golf Digest, Euan has worked in the travel industry for Sheraton in Steamboat Springs, Colorado and Seabourn Cruise Line both onboard the ships and in London. Hugely popular with our clients, Euan now lives near St Andrews with his wife Hilary and three sons, Callum, Hamish and Corey. Allan O’Connor Ireland Operations Manager Our Ireland office in Killarney is managed by Allan O’Connor, who joined the Premier Golf Team in May 2021. Allan has a background in hospitality that stretches back almost 30 years. Out of college in 1993 he became Operations Manager at Kerry Coaches, one of Ireland’s largest private motorcoach operators and pioneers of golf tourism. Prior to taking up his current position he spent 7 years as Director of Sales at The Killarney Park, one of Ireland’s top 5-star hotels, where he spent 9 – 10 weeks a year in the US selling the hotel as perfect destination for all types of guests, but especially golfers. Billy Dunham Product Manager Growing up just miles from the Augusta National Golf Club, Billy’s exposure to golf came early in life when The Masters took over the city each year, and he still carries a (barely) single-digit handicap today. Billy recently completed bucket-list golf trips to Scotland and New Zealand, with golf including The Old Course, Muirfield and Tara Iti. A former airline employee and an avid traveler, he has a passion for aviation and touring the world. His logistics background lends itself to helping plan thoughtfully-created trips. He lives in Northeast Atlanta with his wife Jena and their cats, Gabby and Hazel. Connor Dorton Golf Travel Specialist Originally from Macon, Georgia, Connor moved to the Atlanta area in 2005. A keen golfer since the age of 8, he began working in the golf industry at 16, resulting in a deep and thorough knowledge of the game. Connor has traveled throughout United States to play and caddie at courses including Valhalla and Congressional, a recent highlight was working at the LPGA Drive-On Championship at Reynolds Lake Oconee in 2020. Connor now lives in Woodstock, he regularly caddies at the prestigious Peachtree Golf Club in Atlanta, and is an Atlanta Braves Fan. Chris Gurney Senior Golf Travel Specialist Chris Gurney makes his home in Belleair Florida and has been with Premier Golf since 2009.  Chris grew the company’s PGA Professional business as Director of Business Development and now works as a Golf Travel Specialist. Another of our staff who has traveled extensively, Chris specializes in highly customized group and club travel and escorts trips for our clients on a regular basis. Chris and his wife Daneen share a passion for the opportunity the global golf community offers to meet new people and share in their experiences. Graeme Fish Golf Travel Specialist Originally from North England, Graeme is now based in the Premier Golf St Andrews office. A member of the PGA of GB&I since 1994, Graeme now carries the advanced, accredited status of PGA Fellow Professional. Playing, Teaching, Coaching, Custom Fitting and organizing Golf Holidays are just some of the areas of expertise. With over 30 years in golf, Graeme has worked and played in several countries but specializes in Scotland, Ireland. Ben Baggett Operations Administrator Ben brings vast experience in the golf industry to the Premier Golf Team. He enjoyed over 20 years as a PGA Professional at clubs including; Atlanta National Golf Club, Druid Hills Golf Club, and Houston Lake Country Club. His awards during this time include the 1999 Georgia Section Assistant Professional of the Year. Ben has an Accounting Degree from Kennesaw State University and a Marketing Degree from Georgia College. With over 10 years in accounting roles, Ben now supports Premier Golf operations administration. Father of two, Ben now lives in Acworth and is often found enjoying music, his other great passion. Lucas Worth Sales Administrator Lucas is originally from Pittsburgh, PA, and brings over 12 years of customer service experience to the team. A graduate of West Virginia University, he has called Atlanta home for the past 9 years. Lucas is dedicated to providing exceptional service and building strong, lasting relationships with clients. Outside of work, he enjoys playing golf, spending time outdoors, and relaxing with his wife. He’s also a big Buffalo Bills fan! Jeff DeAngelus Golf Travel Specialist Originally from Rome, Georgia, Jeff has been in the Atlanta area for 25 years, since graduating from Georgia Tech. He brings over 25 years of sales/customer service experience to the team. When not working (or playing golf), he enjoys traveling or camping during any free weekends.  Born and raised to support Atlanta sports! Golf Instruction – About Us | Peak Performance Golf Academy™ About Us Golf Lessons Adult Lessons Junior Lessons Private Lessons Summer Golf Camp Outings & Events Register Now Select Page Golf is a sport that you play for a lifetime. At Peak Performance Golf Academy we know that the game of golf requires as much from the physical body as it does the mind. Which is why we teach students of all ages how to achieve balance through learning the skills and techniques to improve their game. MEET THE INSTRUCTOR Rogerio Higa Owner & Titleist Certified Golf Instructor Born and raised in São Paulo, Brazil owner and golf trainer Rogerio Higa launched Peak Performance Golf Academy in 2015 with a mission to help students of the game improve their skills. Rogerio is Titleist Performance Institute Certified for Adult Level 1 and Junior Golf Levels 1 & 2. Over the last seven years Peak Performance Golf Academy has trained over 70 golfers including 50 junior athletes — 5 of which have gone on to become Junior PGA Tournament champions. Rogerio met his wife of 25 years Heidi Garis while living in Japan. They currently live in Sellersville where together they are raising their teenage daughter.
